title: 107_s1336
content: Reduction of maximum capital gains rates for individuals. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to reduce the maximum capital gains rate for individuals. If a taxpayer has a net capital gain, the tax imposed shall not exceed a certain percentage of the net capital gain or taxable income. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to reduce the maximum capital gains rate for individuals to 15 percent or less. The tax imposed on net capital gain shall not exceed a certain percentage of the net capital gain or taxable income. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to reduce the maximum capital gains rate for individuals to 15 percent or less. The tax on net capital gain shall not exceed a certain percentage of the net capital gain or taxable income. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to reduce the maximum capital gains rate for individuals to 15 percent or less. Amendments include changing various sections from 20 percent to 15 percent. The amendments made by this section apply to taxable years ending after December 31, 2001, and the withholding amendment applies to amounts paid after the date of the enactment of this Act. SEC. 2. Decrease in holding period required for long-term capital gain treatment. The holding period for long-term capital gain treatment is reduced from 1 year to 1 month in various sections of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Amendments include changing the time frame for capital gains and losses, as well as conforming amendments in multiple provisions. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to reduce the holding period for long-term capital gain treatment from 1 year to 1 month in various sections. Amendments apply to dispositions after December 31, 2001.
